text:
HOUSTON — It was a big weekend in Houston for artist Travis Scott and business mogul Kylie Jenner.

Scott received a proclamation from the mayor Houston one day after putting on a huge Astroworld-themed music festival, and

Scott’s most recent album is named after the now-defunct amusement park, which has created quite a bit of nostalgia around the city since it closed in 2005.

On Sunday, Mayor Sylvester Turner declared it “Astroworld Day” in Houston to recognize Scott and the debut of the Astroworld Festival.

Fans of his significant other Kylie Jenner waited in the rain for a chance to see her at a popup shop for her makeup line.

Hundreds of fans, with their cameras ready to go, cheered on Jenner as she arrived.

Hundreds of @KylieJenner fans gathered at @ultabeauty. Here she is taking a video after visiting the store. Her makeup, @kyliecosmetics, her the store today. Hear from fans and the impact she and her boyfriend @trvisXX are making in #Houston at 5:30 & 10. #khou11 pic.twitter.com/GyRFAGvA2x — David Gonzalez (@DavidGonzKHOU) November 18, 2018

She announced on Twitter she was going to be here around noon and fans started camping out.

The 21-year-old’s makeup line, Kylie Cosmetics, has made her a near-billionaire.

She spent about 15 minutes in the store before coming back out and taking more pictures with fans.

Later in the day, Scott's fans showed to his pop-up shop in Rice Village.

Inside the @trvisXX #Astroworld pop-up shop in Rice Village. He’s making a big impact in his home town. #travisscott pic.twitter.com/5TAve3Heje — David Gonzalez (@DavidGonzKHOU) November 19, 2018

© 2018 KHOU
title: Travis Scott, Kylie Jenner wrap up huge weekend in Houston
